name: 6 Days in Mauntain Kilimanjaro -Marangu Route
descriptions:
The Marangu Route has been referred to as the ‘Coca Cola’ route and this has led potential climbers to think
that it is an easy route to the summit. This is far from the truth to be honest! The fact that it requires a
minimum of 5 - 7 days to complete, does not mean that it is easier than any other route. It is one of the
shortest routes, but less than 5 days is not recommended (previous climbing and altitude experience
recommended). It is a popular route, so can be busy in peak season - requiring advance booking of hut
accommodation to avoid any inconveniences. Also popular during the rainy season.
It is the only route where you sleep in huts, rather than tents. An optional acclimatization day at Horombo
Huts is highly recommended for those with no prior trekking in altitude experience under their belt.
The Marangu Route begins from the Kilimanjaro Park Headquarters in the village of Marangu. The trail starts
at 1,800m above sea level in the rain forest and heads westwards towards Kibo. As the altitude increases the
trail goes from the lush rainforest, through heath and moorland to alpine desert and ultimately the arctic
zone at the peak. Ascent of Mt Kilimanjaro’s Crater Rim is at Gilman’s Point (5700m) and although it is only
200m lower than Uhuru Peak - the final ascent can take another hour. The Marangu Route follows the same
trail down to Marangu Gate.

activities.title: Pick up at Kilimanjaro International Airport
Transfer to your hotel in Moshi town
Free time to explore Moshi or relax by the pool
Evening briefing with operations team and mountain guide
Equipment check
Accommodation: Standard or Mid-Range hotels Meals: Dinner Included
Breakfast at the lodge
Transfer to Marangu Gate
Begin trek through dense rainforest
Possible sightings of primates
Visit Maundi Crater for views of the Kenyan interior
Distance covered: 8.3km / 5.2mi Approx. time taken: 5 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included
Early breakfast
Trek through timberline to heath and moor zone
Views of Mawenzi, Kibo, and Maasai steppes
Distance covered: 12.5km / 7.8mi Approx. time taken: 9 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included

itinerary.title: Acclimatization trek to Zebra Rocks (4020m) then back to Horombo Hut (3700m)

activities.title: Relaxing breakfast
Trek to Zebra Rocks
Return to Horombo Hut for lunch
Afternoon relaxation
Distance covered: 5km / 3.1mi Approx. time taken: 4 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included
Long and tough trek
Pass “Last Water point” and “saddle” plateau
Reach Kibo Hut for early evening meal and rest
Distance covered: 9.5km / 5.9mi Approx. time taken: 7 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included

itinerary.title: Kibo Hut (4700m) to UHURU PEAK (5895m) & down to Horombo Hut (3700m)

activities.title: Midnight ascent to summit
Pass Hans Meyer Cave
Reach Gillman’s Point at sunrise
Continue to Uhuru Peak
Descend to Kibo Hut for meal and rest
Proceed to Horombo Hut
Distance covered: 22km / 13.7mi Approx. time taken: 12 – 15 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included
Trek through heath and moor zone to Mandara Hut
Continue through tropical rainforest to Marangu Gate
Transfer back to hotel in Moshi
Distance covered: 20.8km / 12.9mi Approx. time taken: 8 hours Meals: Breakfast & Lunch Included
Rest and relax
Transfer to airport for departure
Meals: Breakfast Included

name: Serengeti Wonders Private Safari
descriptions: Join us for an unforgettable 3-day, 2-night private safari adventure from Arusha, where you'll explore the stunning landscapes and rich wildlife of Tanzania's most famous national parks: the Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater. This exclusive itinerary combines luxury accommodations with expertly guided game drives to offer you a seamless and enriching experience

activities.title: ⁠Depart from Arusha in the morning and drive to the Serengeti National Park (approximately 4-5 hours)
Upon arrival, enjoy an afternoon game drive in the Serengeti, spotting the diverse wildlife
⁠Check into your Luxury Tented Camp and have dinner
⁠Overnight in the Serengeti

itinerary.title: Full Day in Serengeti National Park

activities.title: ⁠Start the day with an early morning game drive to witness the Serengeti's animals at their most active
⁠Return to your accommodation for brunch.
Embark on an afternoon game drive, exploring different areas of the Serengeti.
⁠Dinner and overnight at your luxury tented camp.

itinerary.title: Serengeti to Ngorongoro Crater to Arusha

activities.title: After breakfast, depart the Serengeti and drive to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area (approximately 2-3 hours).
⁠Descend into the Ngorongoro Crater and enjoy a game drive, searching for the abundant wildlife.
⁠Have a picnic lunch within the crater before beginning your ascent.
⁠From Ngorongoro, drive back to Arusha (approximately 2.5 hours).
⁠Arrive in Arusha in the late afternoon.

included.title: ⁠Transfers from/to Arusha by Private 4x4 Landcruiser
⁠2 nights' accommodation at a luxury tented camp or lodge on full board in Serengeti.
Game drives in the Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater
⁠Snacks and Soft Drinks
⁠Park entrance fees
⁠Extra Lunch Boxes
⁠Safari Gifts
⁠Private 4x4 Landcruiser
⁠Private professional English-speaking speaking Guide

name: 7 Days in Mauntain Kilimanjaro -Machame Route
descriptions:
The Machame Route, also referred to as the Whiskey Route, is one of the most popular routes on Mount
Kilimanjaro and a favourite for Marmara Holidays Tanzania - as the owner grew up on the slopes of
Machame.
Despite being a tough climb compared to the Marangu Route, The Machame Route has one of the highest
summit success rates given the topography of the route which allows climbers to “trek high & sleep low”
hence making it a more favorable route for acclimatization. Unlike the Marangu Route which is a gradual
ascent, the Machame Route has steeper trails and climbers walk longer distances.
This route offers some of the most spectacular scenery while on the mountain. The Machame Route starts on
the south-western side of the mountain and proceeds steeply north, traversing the Shira Plateau and
eventually joining the Shira and Lemosho Routes at the Shira camp.

itinerary.title: You will be picked up at the Kilimanjaro International Airport and transferred to your hotel in Moshi town

activities.title: You will be picked up at the Kilimanjaro International Airport and transferred to your hotel in Moshi town
The rest of your day will be free
Explore the small and pretty town of Moshi
Relax by the pool
Later on, our operations team and your mountain guide will meet with you and give you a thorough briefing in preparation for your trek
There will be an equipment check to make sure you have all the necessary mountain gear
Accommodation is either in Standard or Mid-Range hotels depending on your preference Meals: Dinner Included
Half an hour drive from Moshi lies the gate to the Machame route,where you will complete park registrations,
Off on your 6 day trek
The first section of the route climbs steadily and passes through magnificent, dense rainforest
This path is less well-trodden so it can get somewhat overgrown in places and it is often wet and muddy underfoot.
Distance covered: 10km Approx. time taken: 6 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included
Our route continues on up through the forest until we reach the steep ascent onto the Shira Plateau
Enjoy beautiful views of the mountain
Looking back, you will be able to see Mt Meru rising high above Arusha town in the distance.
Distance covered: 4.8km Approx. time taken: 5 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included
Walking now on high moorland, the landscape changes the entire character of the trek
We traverse the southwest side of Kilimanjaro
Passing underneath the Lava Tower and the final section of the Western Breach and finally reach camp The day has been spent at altitude (up to 4600m)
but we have followed the mountaineering code of ‘walk high, sleep low’ to aid your body’s acclimatization to altitude
Distance covered: 10km Approx. time taken: 8 hrs Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included
Our day starts by descending into the start of the Great Barranco, a huge ravine
We then exit steeply, up the Great Barranco Wall, which divides us from the southeastern slopes of Kibo
It’s a climb over rock, not technical but long and tiring
Passing underneath the Heim and Kersten glaciers, we head towards the Karanga valley. From here we have a steep climb up from Karanga valley to our night’s camp at Karanga camp, set at 3963m
For those feeling strong we will go for a mid-afternoon acclimatization trek up to around 4200m before descending back to camp for the night.
Distance covered: 5.5km / 3.4mi Approx. time taken: 5 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included
After a good night’s rest and breakfast, we set off on our walk to Barafu camp at 4640m.
The climb will take us across desolate scree slopes with no vegetation around us at all
It’s a tough steep walk made more difficult by the altitude
On arrival at camp we eat and spend the afternoon resting as we prepare for a long night and day ahead
It is important to keep hydrated and warm. We have an early dinner and then try to get some sleep as we will be getting up at between 11pm and 12pm to start the climb to the summit.
Distance covered: 3km Approx. time taken: 3 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included

itinerary.title: Barafu Camp (4642m) to UHURU PEAK (5895m) & down to Millennium Camp (3801m)

activities.title: We start off at around midnight, and walk steeply upwards to the summit glaciers
We will be climbing scree for 4 to 5 hours but gain incredible height over a short distance. The views are spectacular
We should be on the crater rim at Stella Point (5739m) as the first rays of the sun hit us.
Spectacular ice cliffs within the crater surround us and the views to jagged Mawenzi peak and beyond are breathtaking
Another hour’s walking takes us to the summit, Uhuru Peak (5895m)

We begin our descent by returning to Stella Point and then descending on scree slope and track back to Barafu Camp for breakfast, before finally heading down to Millennium Camp for a long well-earned rest.
Distance covered: 13.4km Approx. time taken: 12 – 15 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included

itinerary.title: Trek Millennium Camp (3801m) to Mweka Gate (1635m)

activities.title: A gentle trek takes us down through the rain forest to Mweka Gate, where we complete park formalities and receive certificates

which you can hang up with pride! We are then met by our vehicles and return to the hotel in Moshi, where you can treat yourself to a welcome shower (and a cold beer or two!) before our big celebration
Overnight in Moshi.
Distance covered: 11.5km Approx. time taken: 6 hours Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included Accommodation: Accommodation is either in mid-range or standard hotels depending on your preference
The day is left free to rest and relax after a long,
Challenging week of trekking
You will be transferred to the airport to catch your morning flight back home.
Meals: Breakfast Included

name: Luxury Private Safari Package
descriptions:
Tarangire National Park: Diverse ecosystem home to large elephant herds and abundant
wildlife.
Ngorongoro Crater: Awe-inspiring volcanic caldera with excep-onal game viewing of the "Big
Five."
Serenge- Na-onal Park: Iconic, vast savanna teeming with an incredible array of wildlife,
including the wildebeest migra-on.
Luxury accommoda-ons: Comfortable tented camps and lodges providing an authen-c, high-
end safari experience.
Private 4x4 transporta-on: Personalized vehicle and professional driver-guide for op-mal
wildlife viewing.
destination: Tarangire National Park, Ngorongoro Crater and Serengeti National Park

activities.title: Depart Arusha and drive to Tarangire National Park.
Enjoy an afternoon game drive in Tarangire, known for its large elephant herds and diverse wildlife.
Overnight at a luxury lodge in Karatu, on the edge of the Ngorongoro Conservation Area.

itinerary.title: Ngorongoro Crater to Serengeti National Park

activities.title: After breakfast, descend into the Ngorongoro Crater for a full-day game drive.
Observe the diverse array of wildlife, including the "Big Five," within the caldera.
Drive from the Ngorongoro Crater to the Serengeti National Park.
Overnight at a Luxury Tented Lodge in the Serengeti.
Spend the day on a game drive in the Serengeti, searching for iconic wildlife and potentially witnessing the wildebeest migration.
Overnight at the same Luxury Tented Lodge in the Serengeti.
Balloon Safari Experience at the heart of Serengeti National Park
After your final game drive in the Serengeti, begin the drive back to Arusha.
Depending on your departure flight schedule, you may have time for last-minute shopping or sightseeing in Arusha.

included.title: 2 nights' accommodation at a luxury Tented Lodge in the Serengeti
1 night's accommodation at a lodge in Karatu, near the Ngorongoro Crater
All transportation in a private 4x4 vehicle with a professional driver-guide
All game drives and park entrance fees
Meals as per the itinerary (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
Extra lunch boxes
Safari Gifts
Pick-up and drop-off at your accommodation in Arusha
Hot air Balloon Safari

excluded.title: Op1onal ac1vi1es or excursions not included in the i1nerary

name: Classic Unforgettable Private Safari
descriptions:
Serengeti National Park: Vast, iconic savanna teeming with diverse wildlife, including the
drama-c wildebeest migra-on.
Ngorongoro Crater: Stunning volcanic caldera oﬀering excep-onal game viewing of the "Big
Five" and other species.
Karatu: Scenic town on the edge of the Ngorongoro Conserva-on Area, serving as a base for
crater explora-on.
Luxury accommoda-ons: Comfortable tented camps providing an authen-c safari experience.
Private 4x4 vehicle: Personalized transporta-on with a professional driver-guide for op-mal
wildlife viewing.
destination: Serengeti National Park and Ngorongoro Crater

activities.title: Depart Arusha in the morning and drive to the Serengeti National Park.
Enjoy an afternoon game drive in the Serengeti, exploring the vast plains and searching for the abundant wildlife.
Overnight at a luxury tented camp in the Serengeti.
Spend the full day on game drives in the Serengeti, following the wildlife and observing their behaviors.
Depending on the time of year, you may witness the dramatic wildebeest migration.
Overnight at the same camp in the Serengeti.
After breakfast, depart the Serengeti and drive to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area.
Descend into the Ngorongoro Crater for a game drive, exploring the caldera and observing the diverse wildlife.
Overnight at a lodge in Karatu, on the edge of the Ngorongoro Crater.
After breakfast, depart Karatu and drive back to Arusha
Depending on your flight schedule, you may have time for some last-minute shopping or sightseeing in Arusha before your departure.
